abstract.p: Photos of patch-pocket pants and skirts seen in New York City (On the Street column) (M)

block.p: Patch pockets can be seen running down the legs of pants and the lengths of skirts everywhere. They were originally adopted from military cargo pants and paratrooper jumpsuits, becoming popular with young counterculturalists and skateboarders, who needed to free their hands. This summer, sophisticated women are wearing variations cut from satins, denim and cotton. But they seldom use the pockets.
